item.description:
Winter in the Whites...and time for ice climbing.  Let's meet up at 8 AM at the Champney Falls Trail head, hike up to Champney Falls, and climb them for the day.  

The trail head is on Route 112 NH (the Kangamangus) 11.5 miles west (and on the south side of the road) from the intersection of 112 and Route 16 in Conway.  

The falls for the ice climb is a bit of a walk to get to--1.8 miles uphill.  The plan is to do top rope climbing on 3's.  If the falls are in poor shape (unlikely), then we'll just have a day of hiking up to Chocorua and back (7 miles round trip).  So, be prepared for good or bad.

You must have mountaineering boots, crampons, harness, locking biner+belay device, helmet, balaclava, two or more pairs of gloves (they get wet), water proof (eg, Gore-Tex) tops and bottoms, warm fleece layers, and thermal wicking layer. If you have ice tools, ropes, biners, screws, anchor material, bring those too.

For more information, check out the FAQ's on ice climbing.

For weather, Accuweather, Mount Washington Observatory

Current ice climbing conditions: neice.com, neclimbs.com

Information on Champney Falls Trail and Chocorua: http://www.hikenewengland.com/MiddleSister071209.html
item.name: Ice Climbing Champney Falls/Mt Chocorua
